alert.note: Alert for Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Otsego County through 1215 AM EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morris, or 10 miles northwest of Oneonta, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartwick, Cooperstown, Edmeston, Pittsfield, Burlington, New Lisbon, Morris, Exeter Center, Oaksville and Gilbert Lake State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. It can be difficult to recognize water over roads at night. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
